name: Max Median
statement: You are a given an array $$$a$$$ of length $$$n$$$. Find a subarray $$$a[l..r]$$$ with length at least $$$k$$$ with the largest median. A median in an array of length $$$n$$$ is an element which occupies position number $$$\lfloor \frac{n + 1}{2} \rfloor$$$ after we sort the elements in non-decreasing order. For example: $$$median([1, 2, 3, 4]) = 2$$$, $$$median([3, 2, 1]) = 2$$$, $$$median([2, 1, 2, 1]) = 1$$$. Subarray $$$a[l..r]$$$ is a contiguous part of the array $$$a$$$, i. e. the array $$$a_l,a_{l+1},\ldots,a_r$$$ for some $$$1 \leq l \leq r \leq n$$$, its length is $$$r - l + 1$$$.
inputFormat: The first line contains two integers $$$n$$$ and $$$k$$$ ($$$1 \leq k \leq n \leq 2 \cdot 10^5$$$). The second line contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \ldots, a_n$$$ ($$$1 \leq a_i \leq n$$$).
outputFormat: Output one integer $$$m$$$ â€” the maximum median you can get.
